name: nalidixic acid
description: A monocarboxylic acid comprising 1,8-naphthyridin-4-one substituted by carboxylic acid, ethyl and methyl groups at positions 3, 1, and 7, respectively. An orally administered antibacterial, it is used in the treatment of lower urinary-tract infections due to Gram-negative bacteria, including the majority of E. coli, Enterobacter, Klebsiella, and Proteus species.

name: voriconazole
description: A triazole-based antifungal agent used for the treatment of esophageal candidiasis, invasive pulmonary aspergillosis, and serious fungal infections caused by Scedosporium apiospermum and Fusarium spp. It is an inhibitor of cytochrome P450 2C9 (CYP2C9) and CYP3A4.

name: ciprofloxacin
description: A  quinolone that is quinolin-4(1H)-one bearing cyclopropyl, carboxylic acid, fluoro and piperazin-1-yl substituents at positions 1, 3, 6 and 7, respectively.

name: monocarboxylic acid
description: An oxoacid containing a single carboxy group.

name: 1,8-naphthyridine derivative
description: Any naphthyridine derivative that is a derivative of 1,8-naphthyridine.

name: quinolone antibiotic
description: An organonitrogen heterocyclic antibiotic whose structure contains a quinolone or quinolone-related skeleton.

name: antimicrobial agent
description: A substance that kills or slows the growth of microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi and protozoans.

name: antibacterial drug
description: A drug used to treat or prevent bacterial infections.

name: DNA synthesis inhibitor
description: Any substance that inhibits the synthesis of DNA.

name: nalidixic acid anion
description: A monocarboxylic acid anion that is the conjugate base of nalidixic acid; major species at pH 7.3.

name: tertiary alcohol
description: A tertiary alcohol is a compound in which a hydroxy group, -OH, is attached to a saturated carbon atom which has three other carbon atoms attached to it.

name: difluorobenzene
description: Any member of the class of fluorobenzenes containing a mono- or poly-substituted benzene ring carrying two fluorine atoms.

name: pyrimidines
description: Any compound having a pyrimidine as part of its structure.

name: conazole antifungal drug
description: Any conazole antifungal agent that has been used for the treatment of fungal infections in animals or humans.

name: triazole antifungal drug
description: Any triazole antifungal agent that has been used for the treatment of fungal infections in humans or animals.

name: P450 inhibitor
description: An enzyme inhibitor that interferes with the activity of cytochrome P450 involved in catalysis of organic substances.

name: quinolinemonocarboxylic acid
description: Any aromatic carboxylic acid that contains a quinoline moiety that is substituted by one carboxy substituent.

name: aminoquinoline
description: Any member of the class of quinolines in which the quinoline skeleton is substituted by one or more amino or substituted-amino groups.

name: cyclopropanes
description: Cyclopropane and its derivatives formed by substitution.
